show.title: Elf
show.headline: The best way to spread Christmas cheer

event.title: <show-title>Elf</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A cheerful celebration with themed games, props & singing loud for all to hear
event.description:
"Buddy the Elf, what's your favorite color?"

Don’t be a cotton-headed ninnymuggins this holiday season. Come out to Alamo Drafthouse and spread the cheer at this sugar-fueled, interactive holiday spectacular, packed with games, props, and, of course, singing loud for all to hear.

Bundle up for this celebration of one of the best holiday films ever made, period. Will Ferrell’s take on a North Pole elf trying to figure out Manhattan (“Watch out! The yellow ones don’t stop!”) just might be the funniest he’s ever been.

Our ELF Movie Party features all sorts of fun props, a gift "wrap off" before the film, and of course, your very own elf hat.

show.title: In a Lonely Place
show.headline: Humphrey Bogart stars in a noir classic of suspicion, intrigue, and suspense

event.title: <show-title>In a Lonely Place</show-title>
event.headline: Bogart breaks hearts (and noses) in Nicholas Ray’s devastating Hollywood noir
event.description:
We’re all writing the version of ourselves we want people to see. But sometimes, we write ourselves into a corner. It’s “noir season” here at Queer Film Theory 101; as the nights grow longer and the shadows loom large, we’re in the mood for something a bit tormented. In Nicholas Ray’s IN A LONELY PLACE, loosely adapted from Dorothy Hughes's novel, struggling screenwriter Dixon Steele (Humphrey Bogart) is suspected of murder after a brief encounter with a young woman who has turned up dead. Dix’s violent temperament and outsider tendencies certainly fit the “prime suspect” archetype, but he’s got an alibi: his beautiful new neighbor Laurel Gray (Gloria Graham) witnessed the encounter. What follows is a torrid romance that forces Dix and Laurel to question what they know about themselves, and what they’re willing to sacrifice for love and desire.

But is it queer you ask? Absolutely. First off, the protagonist's name is Dix Steele… Bogart’s coldly masculine loner screams repressed homosexuality. The gender roles in IN A LONELY PLACE are consistently in flux, with Steele more often exhibiting the unhinged and manipulative traits of a “femme fatale” rather than the '50s leading man. This twisted noir unpacks the lies that grow between men and women, the falseness of identity in Hollywood, and the darkness that takes hold when we begin to believe the worst of each other and ourselves. WHEW! Something tells us we’re going to need a stiff drink and a long look in the mirror after this torrid classic. Welcome to Hollywood, kid, hope you survive the experience.

event.title: <show-title>A Real Pain</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: There's nothing painful about a live Q&A with Jesse Eisenberg
event.description: Join us for an exclusive live Q&A screening of A REAL PAIN, the critically acclaimed road dramedy starring Jesse Eisenberg and Kieran Culkin. After the screening, we’ll sit down for a live chat with star/director Jesse Eisenberg – assuming he doesn’t fall asleep and miss his stop on the train. Don’t miss it, because there’s nothing more painful than FOMO.

show.title: Wicked
show.headline: Defy gravity with the effervescent first chapter of the mega-hit musical

event.title: <show-title>Wicked</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Defy gravity at our interactive, magically fun screening
event.description:
Did you know that real magic actually exists? It’s easy to find if you know where to look, namely at our absolutely magical WICKED Movie Party!

Grab your fellow witches and wizards and join us at Shiz University (i.e., your local Alamo Drafthouse) for an unforgettable screening that will make you feel like defying gravity. There’ll be singing, green-tinted glasses, pink bubbles, Shiz University notebooks, and even broom pens (in case you need to make a quick getaway).

So if you’re popular, like dancing through life, and are ready for some fun at dear old Shiz, then don’t miss this wickedly good Movie Party.

event.description: Enter the world of Oceania at our MOANA 2 Family Party, with themed props and interactive activities for your whole wayfaring crew. Dress up as your favorite MOANA character and get ready to set sail.

show.title: Gremlins
show.headline: Your favorite little monsters invade Christmas, yet again

event.title: <show-title>Gremlins</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Wreak havoc mogwai-style at a fun, interactive screening
event.description:
Need another reason to love Christmas? Then look no further than the adorably devious yuletide creature feature GREMLINS! Joe Dante’s iconic holiday misadventure continues to be a pop culture sensation, with its darkly funny story of a small-town guy who receives a furry little creature called a mogwai that ends up multiplying into a swarm of monsters that rip the town to shreds. Frankly, wanton destruction has never been so fun.

At our GREMLINS Movie Party, we won’t let you tear the place apart or ruin our electronics, but we will have all kinds of fun props available to help you get in on the action, including 3D specs you can use to get a new perspective on SNOW WHITE, light-up necklaces, and masks so you can choose #TeamSpike or #TeamGizmo.

We just ask that you follow these few simple rules:

  • Don’t get a mogwai wet.
  • Don’t expose a mogwai to bright light.
  • Don’t feed a mogwai after midnight.
  • Don’t miss our GREMLINS Movie Party.

show.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation
show.headline: Nothing but the best for the Griswold Family Christmas

posterImages.altText: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation movie poster

event.title: <show-title>National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Celebrate the season like an honorary Griswold
event.description:
No one knows how to do vacations like the Griswolds. Sure, their holidays are wild, chaotic, and often fraught with peril, but everyone’s family gatherings are a little stressful, aren’t they? Fortunately, you can just let Clark and the gang shoulder all that stress while you enjoy the ride at our CHRISTMAS VACATION Movie Party.

And this party is a real beaut, with yuletide props like pine tree air fresheners, yellow glow sticks, and ugly neckties to help you feel like you're an honorary Griswold. It’ll be more fun than a membership to the Jelly of the Month Club.

show.title: Breakfast of Champions
show.headline: Kurt Vonnegut's apocalyptic tragicomedy

event.title: <show-title>Breakfast of Champions</show-title> <event-type-title>w/Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: In-person Q&As with the crew
event.description:
Director Alan Rudolph will be attending our live Q&As in Lower Manhattan on 11/1 and 11/2. Producer David Blocker and composer Mark Isham will be attending our live Q&A in DTLA on 11/15.

BREAKFAST OF CHAMPIONS tells the story of Dwayne Hoover (Bruce Willis), a famous car dealer and the most respected man in Midland City. The American success formula has left Dwayne rich and famous, but also empty and suicidal. He suspects dark motives emanating from his wife (Barbara Hershey), his sales manager (Nick Nolte), and his lover/secretary (Glenne Headly). When Dwayne has a volatile, astonishing encounter with outrageous science-fiction writer Kilgore Trout (Albert Finney) at the Midland City Fine Arts Festival, neither they nor the city is ever the same. (Films We Like)

2k Restoration DCP courtesy of Films We Like and Shout! Studios.

show.title: Nutcrackers
show.headline: Ben Stiller is in over his head in this family comedy

event.title: <show-title>Nutcrackers</show-title> <event-type-title>Free Victory Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: See Ben Stiller's new family comedy before anyone else – free
event.description:
Before the holidays get too nutty, we’re giving Victory members a chance to see the new Christmas comedy NUTCRACKERS first. And because the holidays are all about giving, we’re making this early screening free. Get cracking and reserve your seat today by purchasing a small, fully refundable food and beverage voucher redeemable for snacks and non-alcoholic drinks at the show.

Ben Stiller has been killing it behind the camera lately, directing Severance and Escape at Dannemora, but in NUTCRACKERS, he’s back in front of the camera playing a role he’s perfected – guy who’s in over his head. When the work-obsessed Stiller finds out his sister and her husband have been in an accident, he must head to their farm in rural Ohio and care for his four rambunctious nephews. Director David Gordon Green (PINEAPPLE EXPRESS, HALLOWEEN ENDS) based the movie on the true story of his friend from film school, and cast real-life siblings Homer, Ulysses, Atlas, and Arlo Janson as the nephews. He shot much of the movie on the siblings’ farm as well. A feel-good comedy for the whole family, NUTCRACKERS is out in time for the holidays.

eventType.description: Calling all Victory Members! We’re saying thanks with a free screening. Just buy a food & beverage voucher to reserve your seat, and then use it toward food and drink at the show.

show.title: The World According to Allee Willis
show.headline: An intimate portrait of the artist/songwriter who wrote "September"

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE WORLD ACCORDING TO ALLEE WILLIS

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE WORLD ACCORDING TO ALLEE WILLIS

posterImages.altText: THE WORLD ACCORDING TO ALLEE WILLIS

event.title: <show-title>The World According to Allee Willis</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Director     Alexis Spraci Live in Person
event.description:
With filmmaker Alexis Spraci live in-person

Take one look at award-winning songwriter/artist Allee Willis and you see someone unafraid to be themselves. Dressed in a cacophony of prints and colors, her signature asymmetrical haircut, and famed parties at her real-life Pee-Wee’s Playhouse, Allee didn’t waste any opportunity to tell you what she was about. But privately, Allee struggled with not fitting established gender and sexual norms. She buried herself in her work, until true love manifested her ultimate masterpiece – self-acceptance. Allee began filming her life in 1950s Detroit and never stopped. This film is the realization of her wish that her “final art piece be someone putting together the trail I have left behind.”

show.title: Querelle
show.headline: Rainer Werner Fassbinder’s last and most controversial film

event.title: <show-title>Querelle</show-title>
event.headline: Sex, drugs, and murder abound in Fassbender’s luridly erotic maritime swan song
event.description:
It’s the end of 2024 and Queer Film Theory 101 is going out with bang! While we typically explore films that strictly feature queer subtext, we decided to close out the year with some hardcore overt bisexual cinema from dearly departed queer auteur Rainer Werner Fassbender.

In his final film, QUERELLE, Fassbender releases the hounds of desire and deviance on France! Belgian sailor George Querelle (Brad Davis) arrives in the port of Brest (I mean… come on) aboard the cargo ship Le Vengeur with an appetite for sex, crime, and murder. And then he does those things. That’s the plot. Films aren’t always super complicated. Fassbender’s subversive and grimy adaptation of Jean Genet’s equally controversial novel Querelle of Brest toes the line between exploitation and arthouse with a smattering of Tom of Finland and pulp thrown in the mix, and we love every filthy minute of it. This underseen queer erotic classic has never looked better after a recent digital restoration approved by the director of photography Xaver Schwarzenberger and we can’t wait to experience all of the debaucheries on the big screen with you. Batten down the hatches sailor, there’s a big bisexual storm a-brewin’.

show.title: Silent Night, Deadly Night
show.headline: The infamous 1980s Santa slasher returns

event.title: <show-title>Silent Night, Deadly Night</show-title>
event.headline: The infamous 1980s Santa slasher returns
event.description: Santa Claus is coming to town...and this time, he’s got an axe! Community leaders tried to stop it. The PTA fought to ban it. Now, one of the most controversial slasher films of all time is back in a new restoration from the original camera negative. SILENT NIGHT, DEADLY NIGHT is the demented story of little Billy Chapman, traumatized by his parents’ Christmas Eve murder and then brutalized by sadistic nuns in an orphanage. When Billy grows up and dresses as Santa, he goes on a yuletide rampage to punish the naughty with extreme prejudice. Robert Brian Wilson and Linnea Quigley (NIGHT OF THE DEMONS) star in this harrowing horror classic that continues to ruffle the feathers of angry parents and stuffy critics 40 years later.

event.title: <show-title>Wicked</show-title> <event-type-title>3D Early Access Screenings</event-type-title>
event.headline: Experience a new dimension of the mega-hit musical before anyone else
event.description: Are you the biggest Ozian that is or ever was? Is your rendition of “Popular” almost on par with Chenoweth? Then you need to see WICKED before anyone else at our special Early Access Screening with state-of-the-art 3D projection. It’s the greatest musical of all time breaking onto the big screen and then jumping right off it – what could be better?

eventType.title: Advance Screening
eventType.headline: Be the first to see your new favorite film.
eventType.description: We work with studios, distributors, and filmmaker pals to give our guests a sneak peek at what’s coming down the line.

show.title: Here
show.headline: Tom Hanks & Robin Wright reunite for a lifetime viewed from a single room

show.title: The Polar Express
show.headline: Journey beyond your imagination in this holiday family favorite

event.title: <show-title>The Polar Express</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: All aboard for an interactive holiday adventure the whole family will love
event.description:
Tickets, please. You can’t attend THE POLAR EXPRESS Movie Party without your ticket. And believe us when we tell you that the conductor (one of many Tom Hankses in this movie) is very particular about it.

Once you and the kiddos come aboard this special holiday movie party, we’ll have all sorts of fun surprises waiting for you, including kid-friendly props like a Santa hat, sleigh bells, and some fun activity sheets for you to take home. (And don’t worry, parents, we’ll be sure to lay down some ground rules so you’re not having to listen to jingle bells the whole time.)

With fun props, tasty treats, and more Tom Hankses than you can shake a candy cane at, THE POLAR EXPRESS Movie Party is a delightful, interactive holiday activity the whole family will love.

eventType.title: Movie Party
eventType.headline: Celebrate your fave movies with fun, interactive props, themed drinks, and more
eventType.description: Spanning all genres, Alamo Drafthouse Movie Parties are an immersive, interactive experience for cinema fans featuring fun props, themed drinks, and more.

show.title: When Harry Met Sally...
show.headline: Ring in the new year with the timeless rom-com

show.title: FLASH GORDON
show.headline: He'll save every one of us!

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

formats.title: 2D Digital

formats.title: 3D Digital
formats.headline: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!
formats.description: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!

formats.title: Open Caption
formats.headline: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.
formats.description: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.

agePolicies.name: All Ages
agePolicies.description: All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children ages 6+ admitted. Children 5 and under (including infants) are ONLY admitted during specifically designated "All Ages" and "Family Friendly" screenings.
